title: 'Proud to be back': QB Burrow has 2 TDs in win
content: After missing more than two months with a turf toe injury that required surgery, Bengals QB Joe Burrow threw two touchdowns in a 32-14 win at the Ravens.

title: Lamar cites consistency amid turnovers, slump
content: Ravens QB Lamar Jackson insisted after Thursday's loss to the Bengals there is one solution to get out of his career-worst slump: consistency.

title: Mahomes: Chiefs 'got to win every game now'
content: After the Chiefs' loss to the Cowboys, QB Patrick Mahomes summed up the team's bleak playoff chances. "You've got to win every game now -- and hope that's enough," he said.

title: Thanksgiving Love: Pack QB tosses 4 TDs in win
content: The Packers feasted once again on Thanksgiving, with QB Jordan Love tossing four touchdown passes in a 31-24 win over the Lions.

title: Campbell: Lions in 'little bit of a hole' after loss
content: Even coach Dan Campbell could admit after the Lions' 31-24 Thanksgiving Day loss to the Packers, that "we've dug ourselves a little bit of a hole" at 7-5 overall.

title: Questions, takeaways from Thanksgiving matchups: Our reporters break down every game
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer big questions from each Week 13 game, starting with Thanksgiving Day matchups.

title: WWE Survivor Series: Key stats and info to know before WarGames
content: As we approach Saturday's WWE premium live event, let's catch up on some notes and stats for each match.

title: Preview: Can the teams coexist?
content: Breaking down the biggest storylines at Survivor Series: WarGames, including John Cena's final PLE match.

title: 37 games with postseason implications to fill your Rivalry Week menu
content: As if the intensity of rival games weren't enough, there are high stakes everywhere you look this weekend.

title: Week 14 preview: Rivalry Week stakes, plus conference championship scenarios
content: Ahead of Rivalry Week, our college football experts get into the stakes in the biggest matchups of Week 14.

title: Where is the best landing spot for Lane Kiffin?
content: The coach will announce his decision later in the week. Here's what he might be weighing in the meantime.

title: Women's Feast Week guide: Texas wins inaugural Players Era on Harmon's game winner
content: With Players Era wins over UCLA and South Carolina, Texas established itself as the No. 2 team in the country.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 3.0: Reyna, Scally back in the fold
content: We're closing in on the new year, and with months until the World Cup begins, which U.S. players are best positioned to make next year's squad?

title: Chaos for Barcelona and Liverpool, Arsenal No. 1: Reranking the Champions League
content: With just three games left, Arsenal look like the best team in the competition, while Barcelona, Liverpool and Man City are spiraling. Let's review how the UEFA Champions League looks after Matchday 5.

title: Talking points: Pep's tinkering costs City, Arsenal look unstoppable
content: Statement wins, coaches under pressure and bizarre team selections. ESPN writers break down Matchday 5.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Everything to know before Friday's final night of group play
content: The 2025 NBA Cup continues as group play wraps up. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

title: How Tyrese Maxey went from the hardwood to the 2025 National Dog Show
content: The Philadelphia 76ers star ran two dogs through the Purina Pro Plan Incredible Dog Challenge Agility Show while the show taped in Philadelphia.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: Why players say league's latest proposal is 'slap in the face'
content: The Nov. 30 WNBA deadline is looming for a new CBA. The two sides continue to meet during the holiday week.

title: The Thanksgiving Panic Index: Which NHL teams are the most concerned?
content: Teams in playoff position on the holiday tend to stay there (77.1% since 2005). Who is in the best and worst shape?

title: MLB offseason survey: 16 execs predict free agency, blockbuster trades and more
content: We surveyed the sport on the biggest free agents and top trade candidates as baseball's hot stove heats up.

title: NFL Week 13 buzz: What we're hearing on the struggling Bucs, Pickens' next deal, fantasy football
content: Are the Buccaneers worried about their losing streak? Will the Cowboys extend George Pickens? Here's the latest intel, plus fantasy football advice.

title: Black Friday betting: Big games coming for Hurts, Barkley vs. streaking Bears?
content: Odds, game bets, prop plays and analysis to help you bet the Chicago Bears-Philadelphia Eagles Black Friday matchup.

title: Is it time for McLaren to prioritize Norris over Piastri?
content: McLaren has refused to favor one driver over the other all season, but as Max Verstappen closes in, should the Papaya outfit issue team orders?

title: Fantasy fast break: Eric Moody on Mikal Bridges' durability, Kel'el Ware's rise and more
content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Mikal Bridges' durability and production in New York, Kel'el Ware's second-year rise and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City to rival Arsenal for rising Spain star Mendoza
content: Arsenal may have to compete with Manchester City to sign Elche midfielder Rodrigo Mendoza. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Delhi car blast: Al-Falah chancellor forged papers to grab land of deceased Hindu owners
content: Enforcement Directorate has alleged that Al-Falah University chancellor Javed Ahmed Siddiqui fraudulently obtained Delhi land by forging documents of deceased Hindu landowners. The agency claims a fake General Power of Attorney, dated 2004, was used to transfer property in Madanpur Khadar to a trust linked to Siddiqui.  The investigation into this alleged land scam is ongoing with Siddiqui in ED custody.

title: Hong Kong tragedy: Fire alarms of affected buildings failed; toll rises to 128
content: The death toll from a devastating blaze at Hong Kong's Wang Fuk Court residential complex has climbed to 128, with fire alarms reportedly malfunctioning. Investigations into the cause are ongoing, focusing on renovation materials, and three men have been arrested on suspicion of manslaughter and gross negligence.

title: VIP crash: Stage crashes as BJP netas crowd around bride and groom at UP wedding
content: A wedding stage at a ceremony in Ballia district, Uttar Pradesh, collapsed late Wednesday evening while VIP guests were blessing the newlyweds. The structure, reportedly lacking proper support, gave way as around 12-14 guests and the bride and groom stood on it for photographs. Fortunately, no injuries were reported in the incident.

title: India's new quake map: Himalayan arc in highest danger zone; major shift in decades
content: India has released a new earthquake map. The entire Himalayan region is now in the highest risk zone. Over 60% of India faces moderate to high earthquake hazards. New building codes will ensure greater safety. Infrastructure projects must meet stricter standards. This update reflects a scientific approach to seismic assessment.

title: Trade push: India in talks with US, EU; to resume negotiations with Canada
content: India is actively pursuing free trade agreements with key global players like the US and EU, alongside around 50 other nations and blocs. Commerce minister Piyush Goyal highlighted the strategic importance of "trusted partners" amid rising global trade risks. Discussions are progressing with the GCC, New Zealand, and Israel, while talks with Canada are set to resume.

title: Vibe Coding in spotlight: Google CEO on its power for non-tech grads; says it can help them build tech careers
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai heralds 'vibe coding' as a revolutionary force, democratizing tech by empowering non-technical professionals to build applications through simple AI prompts. This shift is already reshaping workplaces, with professionals in diverse fields leveraging tools like ChatGPT and Gemini to create functional prototypes. While acknowledging limitations for critical systems, Pichai expresses immense optimism for AI's future in software development, envisioning a more accessible and enjoyable coding landscape for everyone.

title: 'Blood on your hands': TMC slams EC over SIR; submits list of 40 who allegedly lost lives
content: A Trinamool Congress delegation met the Chief Election Commissioner, presenting a list of 40 deaths, including 17 BLOs, allegedly linked to the ongoing special intensive revision exercise. The party accused the EC of having "blood on your hands" over the fatalities.

title: Chief selector Agarkar: A constant on overseas tours; an absentee from domestic cricket
content: Australia, Dubai, England, Dubai, and again Australia. In the last 12 months, Ajit Agarkar has been a constant figure on India's overseas tours. He even had fellow selector SS Das on two tours. Except the same appearance consistency hasn't been followed for Ranji Trophy matches. The former India cricketer had been accused of not watching enough local games even during his time as Mumbai selector and was forced to resign from the position

title: Apple vs $38 billion fine: Apple goes to High Court to avoid penalty; calls it unconstitutional and unjust
content: Apple is challenging India's new antitrust penalty framework in Delhi High Court, fearing a potential $38 billion fine based on global turnover. The iPhone maker argues the amended law, allowing penalties on worldwide revenue, is unconstitutional and disproportionate. This challenge follows an investigation into Apple's App Store practices and mandatory in-app purchase system.

title: Stock markets at lifetime highs: What should investors do? Six mistakes to avoid
content: As markets rally, investors face six behavioural traps that can derail wealth. Overconfidence, panic selling after gains, FOMO-driven entries, succumbing to tips, ignoring diversification, and using borrowed money are highlighted. Prudent investors maintain discipline, stick to strategy, and avoid impulsive decisions to safeguard their long-term financial future.

title: Putin-Modi meet: Russian president to visit India on December 4; what's on agenda?
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is scheduled to visit India on December 4-5 for a summit with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Discussions are expected to focus on India's potential procurement of additional S-400 air-defense squadrons and Sukhoi-57 fighter jets. The ongoing Russia-Ukraine war will also be a key agenda item, with India reiterating its support for an early peaceful resolution.

title: 'Children are choking': Rahul questions PM Modi on Delhi pollution; asks how can you stay silent?
content: Rahul Gandhi has demanded a parliamentary discussion on Delhi's severe air pollution, labeling it a health emergency. He criticized Prime Minister Modi's silence and the government's lack of an urgent, enforceable action plan. Gandhi met with concerned mothers, highlighting their fears for children breathing toxic air and urging accountability for clean air.

title: Apple iPhone 17 available for Rs 45,900 in Croma Black Friday Sale: Know how to grab the deal
content: Croma's Black Friday Sale offers the iPhone 17 at an effective Rs 45,900, a significant reduction from its Rs 82,900 launch price. This deal, valid until November 30, 2025, combines bank cashback, substantial exchange value, and a fixed bonus.  It makes Apple's latest non-Pro model more accessible, featuring a 120Hz ProMotion display and the A19 chip.

title: 'Real teammates': Suniel Shetty in awe; hails Jemimah for standing by Mandhana
content: Bollywood actor Suniel Shetty lauded cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues for withdrawing from the Women's Big Bash League to support her friend Smriti Mandhana during a personal crisis. Rodrigues' decision to stay in India after Mandhana's wedding postponement due to her father's health complication was hailed as pure camaraderie.

title: Sri Lanka: 56 killed as floods, landslides triggered by torrential rains batter the island; dozens missing
content: Sri Lanka faces a catastrophic scenario as relentless rains unleash devastating floods and landslides across the nation. At least 56 lives have been tragically lost, with 21 individuals still unaccounted for. The destruction has left over 600 homes in ruins, displacing nearly 44,000 residents.

title: Asia Cup: India U19 squad announced; high-stakes Pak clash on Dec 14
content: India's U19 squad for the ACC Men's Asia Cup has been unveiled, with Ayush Mhatre leading the 15-member team. Teen sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi headlines the batting lineup. The young brigade faces Pakistan on December 14 in Dubai, aiming to assert dominance in the tournament commencing December 12.

title: Delhi man takes dummy ‘corpse’ to funeral to fake employee death, claim insurance
content: A Delhi man was apprehended in Uttar Pradesh for attempting to defraud an insurance company by presenting a mannequin as his deceased employee. He planned to cremate the dummy, obtain a death certificate, and claim a Rs 50 lakh insurance policy to clear his debts. The employee, unaware of the plot, was contacted by police.

title: Reliance Industries Ltd: Shares hits fresh 52-week high as Jefferies reaffirms 'buy'
content: Reliance Industries' shares hit a new 52-week high after Jefferies reiterated its "Buy" rating, citing strong double-digit growth across its digital, energy, and retail businesses. The brokerage highlighted tailwinds from festive demand, expanding FMCG operations, and firm refining margins, projecting significant upside for the stock.

title: MLB rumors: Mets could target $15M Padres starter after Dylan Cease deal
content: The New York Mets are reportedly eyeing San Diego Padres pitcher Michael King as their next major acquisition following Dylan Cease's record-breaking contract. King, who excelled as a starter before a mid-season injury, now represents a high-upside option for the Mets amidst a shifting pitching market.  His potential return to peak form makes him an intriguing target.

title: Nick Fuentes seeks proof after Candace Owens links deaths to alleged plot
content: Candace Owens' explosive claims on X, alleging French President Macron and his wife paid for her assassination and French Legion soldiers killed Charlie Kirk, have been met with skepticism. Right-wing commentator Nick Fuentes publicly demanded proof, calling her stories 'crazy' and lacking evidence, particularly mocking her claims about Brigitte Macron's family history and gender.

title: Chinese giant mulls India battery plant, plans $34 million output
content: China's Envision Group is considering a $34 million battery manufacturing plant in India, aiming to support the nation's renewable energy integration. The proposed facility would assemble battery systems, utilizing Chinese-sourced cells while developing local racks and software. This move comes as India faces storage shortages, hindering its renewable energy expansion and grid stability.

title: 'Will permanently pause migration': Trump's big warning to 'third world countries'
content: US President Donald Trump announced plans to permanently halt migration from "Third World Countries" to allow the US system to recover. He further linked this decision to an alleged White House shooting incident involving an Afghan national and the US evacuation from Afghanistan, citing concerns about unvetted individuals entering the country.

title: IND vs SA: 'Emotional coach' - AB de Villiers' explosive verdict on Gautam Gambhir
content: Following India's Test series loss to South Africa, Gautam Gambhir's coaching is under fire. Former cricketer AB de Villiers suggested Gambhir's emotional nature as a player might translate to his coaching, potentially unsettling the team. While acknowledging no single coaching formula works, De Villiers contrasted this with South Africa's calm coach, highlighting varied player preferences for leadership styles.

title: ‘Words & worlds revolving ...: BJP mocks K'taka tussle; takes ‘Congress vs Congress’ dig
content: The BJP has mocked the Congress's internal power struggle in Karnataka, calling it an "OTT series of 'Congress vs Congress'."  BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla criticized the party's focus on "power, the chair, and leadership" over public issues.  This comes amid a public exchange between CM Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar regarding leadership and promises.

title: 'Bihar dirty because ... ': Man appeals to train passengers to not litter; video viral
content: A man's viral video shows him politely urging train passengers to avoid littering, emphasizing personal responsibility for cleanliness. His appeal highlights that individual habits contribute to the perception of India and Bihar being dirty. While some praised his civic sense, others suggested authorities should lead such initiatives.

title: Kap's cafe shooting in Canada: Main conspirator of Goldy Dhillon gang arrested
content: Delhi Police's crime branch has arrested Bandhu Maan Singh Shekhon, a key member of the Goldy Dhillon gang, in connection with multiple shootings at Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe in Canada. The incidents, claimed by the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, involved firing shots and hurling Molotov cocktails, with a Chinese pistol seized during the arrest.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for Nov 28? Here's what investors should do
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are showing a bullish bias, trading steady near ₹1,25,540. Technical indicators suggest a buy-on-dips strategy around ₹1,25,500, with support at ₹1,25,350 and resistance at ₹1,25,850. Investors are advised to maintain a stop-loss below ₹1,25,250 for potential upside targets.

title: 'Aadhaar no longer accepted as proof of birth': New order in UP and Maharashtra
content: Uttar Pradesh has declared Aadhaar cards invalid as proof of birth date, with the Planning Department issuing a directive to all state departments. This decision comes amidst broader actions by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to identify and deport illegal immigrants, including the establishment of temporary detention centers in each district.

title: 2 surgeries, years on hospital beds: Abhishek Reddy's incredible comeback
content: Despite facing career-threatening injuries and two surgeries, Abhishek Reddy's unwavering determination fueled his return to cricket.  A remarkable 247 in the Ranji Trophy against Jharkhand marked his triumphant comeback, proving his enduring passion.  Inspired by Sachin Tendulkar, Reddy's journey highlights resilience and the pursuit of dreams against all odds.

title: Cyclone Ditwah alert: 4 Colombo-bound flights diverted to Trivandrum
content: Five international flights bound for Sri Lanka were diverted to Thiruvananthapuram International Airport on Friday due to bad weather and a cyclone warning over Colombo. Flights from Dubai, Doha, Abu Dhabi, Kuala Lumpur, and Mumbai landed safely. Separately, an Air India flight returned to Delhi after a false smoke warning in its cargo hold.

title: 'No proof of life': Imran Khan’s son sparks new round of doubts amid health rumours
content: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan's son alleges his father is held in a death cell with no transparency. Kasim Khan states there have been no calls or meetings, and no proof of life. Khan's sisters have been denied visits despite court orders. The family urges international intervention and proof of life.

title: IND vs SA: Is India bothered about Test debacle?
content: India's Test cricket legacy is rapidly declining, particularly at home, as the focus shifts to white-ball glory from junior levels. This prioritization of T20 and ODI formats has led to a neglect of red-ball skills, with junior selectors and players alike prioritizing white-ball success, impacting the development of Test specialists.

title: Air emergency in Delhi: AQI remains 'very poor'; Anand Vihar clocks 408
content: Delhi woke to a thick smog blanket as winter sets in, with the AQI reaching 384, categorizing it as 'Very Poor'. Several areas reported 'Severe' levels, exceeding 400. While authorities lifted Stage III restrictions, vigilance under earlier stages continues to prevent further deterioration. Residents noted increased pollution, with one attributing it to volcanic ash.

title: Kapil Sharma’s Cafe shootings: Mastermind arrested by Delhi Police
content: Delhi Police have apprehended Bandhu Maan Singh Shekhon, a key operative of the Goldy Dhillon gang, in connection with the shootings at Kapil Sharma's Canadian cafe.  Shekhon allegedly coordinated the overseas attacks from India.  The cafe faced three shooting incidents and Molotov cocktail attacks, with gangs claiming responsibility and issuing further threats, including one targeting Mumbai.

title: Bengaluru techie, injured in bike crash, dies after ambulance gets stuck
content: A software engineer died after his motorbike skidded and he fell unconscious with severe head injuries. The ambulance transporting him to the hospital got stuck under a "magic box," delaying his arrival. Meanwhile, 23 passengers were injured when a KSRTC bus rear-ended a commercial vehicle.

title: 'Bandh hai’: Once a lifeline for distressed women, Delhi Mahila Aayog lies defunct
content: Since Jan 2024, the Delhi Commission for Women has had no chairperson, and no members since July 2024. In May 2024, Women and Child Development dept ordered removal of 223 contractual staffers over “improper” hiring . The last chairperson, Swati Maliwal, resigned after being elected to the Rajya Sabha in Jan 2024.

title: 'Both had to do something in India': Congress leader claims CIA–Mossad behind 2014 rout
content: A war of words erupted between Congress and BJP after former MP Kumar Ketkar alleged US and Israeli intelligence agencies meddled in the 2014 elections. BJP MP Sambit Patra countered, attributing BJP's victories to public support and accusing Congress of following Pakistan's ISI agenda.

title: Hong Kong high-rise blaze: Death toll climbs to 94 - latest developments
content: A devastating fire ripped through Hong Kong's Wang Fuk Court apartment complex, claiming 94 lives and leaving scores unaccounted for. Firefighters battled the blaze for two days amidst severe obstacles, with the fire believed to have started in scaffolding. Investigations are underway as residents report a lack of fire alarms.

title: Cyclone Ditwah alert: Storm may hit Tamil Nadu in 2 days; IMD upgrades alerts to red
content: Cyclone Ditwah is poised to bring heavy rainfall to north Tamil Nadu, with red alerts issued for delta and coastal districts on November 28-29. Chennai and neighboring areas face orange alerts for heavy to very heavy rain on November 29-30. Wind speeds are expected to reach 60-80kmph, with potential for extremely heavy downpours in specific locations.

title: Sidda vs DKS: Power-sharing tussle rages in Karnataka Congress; top developments
content: Karnataka's chief ministerial post sees intensified tussle between Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar camps. Both leaders defer to the Congress high command, while political signalling and speculation about a power-sharing arrangement continue. Key developments include meetings and community group support for Shivakumar, alongside his son's backing of the current CM.

title: 'Reunion of the Year': Dhoni drives Kohli back after dinner in Ranchi - video
content: A heartwarming video of MS Dhoni driving Virat Kohli back to his hotel after a private dinner at Dhoni's Ranchi residence has gone viral. The rare sight, with no security, evoked nostalgia for their decade-long partnership. Kohli is in Ranchi for the ODI series against South Africa, marking his return to the city.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 85,750
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 was above 26,200, BSE Sensex was near 85,750.

title: ‘It’s like Covid’: Kiran Bedi flags Delhi pollution crisis; claims AQI hits 587 in Indirapuram
content: Former IPS officer Kiran Bedi has voiced grave concerns over Delhi's hazardous air quality, with the AQI reaching alarming levels. She highlighted the severe health impacts and the need for stronger political leadership, advocating for Prime Minister's intervention to coordinate multi-state efforts.

title: Daughter's 1st birthday: Diogo Jota's widow posts heartbreaking tribute
content: Diogo Jota's widow, Rute Cardoso, shared an emotional first-birthday tribute to their baby daughter, posting poignant photos of the late Liverpool star. The images, including five with Jota, have evoked widespread love and grief, underscoring the profound impact of his tragic death. Jota died in a car crash just weeks after marrying Rute, leaving behind their three children.

title: 67 kg hydro ganja in 10 days: Bengaluru Customs nets massive drug hauls in airport interceptions
content: The seizures, all made at Terminal 2 between November 17 and November 27, involved passengers arriving primarily from Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Will PM Modi take up South Africa's cause with ‘good friend’ Trump, asks Congress
content: Donald Trump said that he is barring South Africa from participating in the Group of 20 summit next year in Miami and will "stop all payments and subsidies" to the country

title: Congress in Kerala walks a tight rope as CPI(M), BJP ramp up demand for MLA Rahul Mamkootathil’s resignation
content: UDF convener Adoor Prakash questions timing of allegations, while dissent within Congress grows, with Rajmohan Unnithan, MP, warning of backlash for inaction. Protests erupt in Mamkootathil’s Palakkad constituency as CPI(M) and BJP leaders condemn Congress for allegedly ‘shielding offenders’

title: Russian President Vladimir Putin to visit India on December 4-5
content: India has been calling for an end to the Ukrainian conflict with Prime Minister Modi describing the Indian policy as “this is not the time for war”

title: Parakamani theft case: TTD former chairman Subba Reddy appears before CID
content: The CID officials obtained a statement from Mr. Subba Reddy on his version of the theft of currency by counting supervisor C.V. Ravi Kumar from the offerings made to the Tirumala temple

title: Arunachal Pradesh State Election Commission introduces on-the-spot voting facility for personnel engaged in civic poll duty
content: The Mandal Revenue Officer, after verifying the identity and appointment order of the personnel, will mark the voter's name on the electoral roll and provide a ballot paper for on-the-spot voting

title: Anti-conversion law: Supreme Court seeks Rajasthan Government's response on plea challenging validity
content: A Bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta issued notice to Rajasthan Government seeking its response on the plea filed by the Peoples Union For Civil Liberties and others

title: Kashmir experiences coldest November since 2007; Mercury in Srinagar drops to -4.5°C
content: Several weather stations across the valley recorded their lowest night temperatures in November since 2007

title: Ambedkar statue vandalised in U.P.'s Ballia
content: Angry villagers demand immediate action against the culprits, the construction of a protective boundary wall, and the installation of CCTV cameras

title: From fan to friend: A Keralite’s life-long bond with Dharmendra
content: 63-year-old Saifullah Cholakkal from Malappuram reflects on his deep, personal friendship with Bollywood icon Dharmendra, cherished memories, and profound loss

title: A former Minister and his ‘vada case’
content: Reporting from court is always exciting, especially during criminal cases, as K.A. Sengottaiyan’s trials from the late 1990s showed

title: Woman dies after standing in queue for ‘two days’ to get fertiliser; BJP MLA questions M.P. Government
content: The incident occurred late on November 26, at the Bagri fertiliser distribution centre, and the woman was identified as Bhuriya Bai from Kushepur village

title: Maharashtra orders cancellation of Aadhaar-based birth certificates
content: The circular said that Aadhaar cannot be accepted as standalone proof of date or place of birth, in line with Central Government guidelines

title: Demolition of Bidhan Bhavan: Meghalaya High Court orders status quo
content: Bidhan Bhavan was constructed before 1923 by Dr. Bidhan Chandra Roy, who later became West Bengal CM, and it served as a summer retreat for his family

title: Documenting the panic in Bengal over SIR
content: Here’s a collection of ground reports and analyses, uncovering the impact of SIR on people of Bengal

title: Modi in Udupi: PM welcomed by massive crowds at roadshow, recites Gita verses with lakhs of devotees at Sri Krishna Mutt
content: The PM will inaugurate the Suvarna Tirtha Mantapa, located in front of the Krishna sanctum, and dedicate the Kanaka Kavacha (golden cover) for the sacred Kanakana Kindi in the temple.

title: Odisha revises Maoist surrender, rehabilitation policy; enhances financial aid
content: Odisha's Home Department, in a notification, said, "The objective of the surrender and rehabilitation policy is to contain and eradicate left wing extremism in the State”

title: Madras High Court bars use of Ilaiyaraaja’s songs in movie ‘Dude’
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar grants an interim injunction restraining the use of two of his old songs ‘Nooru Varusham’ and ‘Karutha Machan’ in the Pradeep Ranganathan-starrer Tamil movie

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Several Tamil Nadu districts announce half-day holiday for schools due to rain
content: With Cyclone Ditwah warning in the State, rainfall warning has been sounded in many districts across Tamil Nadu

title: Fire erupts after car-bus collision in Telangana’s Shankarpally; major tragedy averted
content: The bus was travelling from Vikarabad towards Hyderabad when the speeding car, coming from the opposite direction, rammed into it head-on

title: Haryana’s Special Task Force arrests gangster; seizes explosives, foils major attack plot in Karnal
content: Acting on a specific intelligence input, the Special Task Force (STF) team led by Inspector Deependra Singh, apprehended gangster Amar Singh, who is involved in several criminal cases

title: As six Assam communities seek ST status, seven more eye OBC list
content: The Chairman of the National Commission for Backward Classes conducted a public hearing with representatives of the seven communities in Guwahati on Thursday, November 27.

title: FIR filed against Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil over alleged sexual exploitation, coerced abortion and threats
content: Police say charges against Palakkad MLA include rape, obtaining sexual consent through deceitful means, possibly by holding forth a false promise of marriage, and coercing a woman into terminating her pregnancy

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Five Colombo-bound flights diverted to Thiruvananthapuram airport due to bad weather
content: Diverted flights include an Etihad Airways flight from Abu Dhabi, AirAsia flight from Kuala Lampur, Sri Lankan Airlines flight from Dubai, Sri Lankan Airlines flight from Doha and a domestic Indigo flight

title: How the Parakamani scam in Tirumala unfolded
content: The Parakamani case at Lord Venkateswara temple on Tirumala, hitherto a case of dishonesty and theft, now smacks of something far murkier after the complainant and a key witness in the case, a vigilance officer, was found dead on railway tracks on November 14

title: The illusion of flow: U-turns slowing Hyderabad down
content: Once promoted as a smart fix to free up traffic, Hyderabad’s expanding U-turn network is now choking major corridors, triggering violations and contributing to more crashes. As officials scramble for solutions, Lavpreet Kaur and Naveen Kumar trace the mounting commuter angst and widening cracks in the city’s traffic strategy

title: Rupee falls 7 paise to 89.43 against U.S. dollar in early trade
content: At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 89.41; it slipped further to trade at 89.43 against the greenback in initial deals, registering a loss of 7 paise from its previous closing level.

title: In 10 years, this government hospital in Chennai has performed 31,157 interventional cardiac procedures
content: The department has performed among the highest volumes of ASD device closures in the government sector in Tamil Nadu

title: Kerala local body polls: Rivals will seek to loosen LDF’s firm grip on Kollam Corporation
content: Since the formation of the Corporation in 2000, the Left front has been in power. This time, the CPI(M) is not fielding a single sitting member of the current council, hoping that a totally new line-up will get voters’ approval. While the UDF is looking for a recovery from a major setback in the 2020 elections, the NDA, having tripled its seats in 2020, is highly optimistic about its prospects

title: Kerala local body polls: Writing on the wall is clear, charm of poll graffiti doesn’t fade
content: The old world charm of the wall art is something that political parties and candidates do not want to miss. Graffiti has evolved in terms of colour, design and font

title: Kerala local body polls: Development beckons, but coastal Thiruvananthapuram continues to battle age-old issues
content: Lack of potable water and proper waste disposal mechanism have been issues faced by areas near Vizhinjam for decades. Dwindling catch, eroding beaches and fewer employment opportunities will be key issues in the coastal areas in the local body elections

title: Forcing happily-married couple to face trial under POCSO Act would be irony of fate: Allahabad HC
content: The woman's father got the FIR lodged, alleging that his daughter was abducted in April 2024; the woman had denied the allegations in her statement before police and stated that she had left her parents' home willingly.

title: The hidden costs of 10-minute deliveries in Bengaluru
content: Multiple platforms offering 10-minute door delivery of anything under the sun and the middle class getting addicted to it has consequences often not talked about. Chetan B.C. explores how gig economy is adding to traffic and law and order issues.

title: Hong Kong Fire Deaths Rise To 128, Dozens Still Missing
content: The death toll in a fire that ripped through a Hong Kong residential estate this week has risen to 128, the city's security chief said Friday.

title: On CCTV, Gang War With Thar, Bikes And Guns In Rajasthan
content: Group bikers, rivalry, road rage, guns and the SUV Thar that has gained a reputation of sorts. This combination screamed trouble. And that's what happened in Rajasthan's Bansur when three bikers and some people in a Thar and a Maruti Swift.

title: No Arrests Yet In Attack On Baul Singers In Bangladesh, Yunus Faces Criticism
content: Despite mounting criticism over the brutal attacks on Baul singers, Muhammad Yunus' government in Bangladesh has said it has issued instructions to arrest the perpetrators. However, no arrests have been made so far

title: A Judiciary vs Centre Face-Off, Not In Supreme Court, But Badminton Court
content: The exhibition matches are the highlight of the two-day tournament that will see participation of 84 judges from the Supreme Court and high courts

title: India Ranks Third In Asia Power Index 2025, Just Behind US And China
content: India has secured third ranking in Asia Power Index 2025 while the United States and China occupy the first and second spot respectively, a globally reputed thinktank said in its findings.

title: Another Word Added To Trump's Insult Of Women Journalists: "Stupid"
content: US President Donald Trump called a female reporter stupid on Thursday, adding to the litany of insults he has dealt to women in the media when he dislikes their questions.

title: Russian President Vladimir Putin To Visit India On December 4-5
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will be in India on December 4-5 to attend the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit.

title: Heavy Rain Expected In Coastal Andhra Due To Cyclonic Storm Ditwah
content: Andhra Pradesh State Disaster Management Authority on Friday said that heavy rains are expected in Coastal Andhra and Rayalaseema on Saturday and the day after due to the impact of cyclonic storm Ditwah.

title: Kashmir Records Coldest November Since 2007 At Minus 6 Degrees Celsius
content: Kashmir is experiencing its coldest November since 2007, with minimum temperatures dipping below the freezing point across several locations, officials said on Friday.

title: Amid Death Rumours, A Look Back At When Imran Khan Was Shot In Leg In 2022
content: Rumours about the death of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan have intensified in recent days, after an Afghan media report claimed he died in custody inside Adiala Jail.

title: Rahul Gandhi Calls Air Pollution "Health Emergency", Questions PM Modi
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday demanded a detailed discussion in Parliament on the issue of air pollution in the national capital as he questioned the silence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on this "health emergency".

title: Nainital Announces Measures To Avoid Traffic Jams During Wedding Season
content: In view of increased traffic congestion during the wedding season, authorities in Uttarakhand's Nainital district have announced several measures in Haldwani to avoid disruptions, an official said.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: What The Name Means And When It Will Make Landfall
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued alerts for heavy rains, accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning, for Tamil Nadu, Rayalaseema, Andhra Pradesh, and Kerala on Friday, under the influence of cyclonic storm Ditwah'.

title: Donald Trump's "Failed Nations" Mention In '3rd World Migration' Bombshell
content: In his post announcing the decision to pause migration from all third-world countries, US President Donald Trump said the refugee burden is the "leading cause of social dysfunction in America"

title: How SIR Verification Visit Brought Missing Rajasthan Man Home After 45 Years
content: Amid the Special Intensive Revision unrest, a case from Rajasthan's Bhilwara has stood out where the SIR verification drive helped reunite a man with his family 45 years after he went missing.

title: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu Reveals Strange Acquisition Pitch Followed By AI Apology
content: Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu has detailed an unusual email exchange involving a startup founder and an artificial intelligence agent, raising questions about how AI tools are being used in business correspondence.

title: Trump Orders Review Of Green Cards: Who Can Apply, Process, Fee Explained
content: Trump has ordered a sweeping re‑examination of all green cards issued to immigrants belonging to the flagged nations.

title: "Apathy Will Kill Us": Actress Soni Razdan As Mumbai Winter Smog Worsens
content: Actress Soni Razdan, who is the mother of Bollywood star Alia Bhatt, has called for urgent seasonal measures to tackle Mumbai's deteriorating air quality, saying winter conditions demand a different plan to keep the city's smog in check.

title: Tyre Puncture, Daring Escape, Encounter: How Rape Accused Was Caught
content: The 144-hour-long manhunt for Salman, alias Nazar, the 23-year-old accused in the horrific rape of a six-year-old girl in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district, ended with a dramatic, movie-style police encounter.

title: Trump Just Threatened Third World Countries - Which Are They?
content: Donald Trump’s latest remarks on suspending migration came after a deadly ambush-style shooting killed a National Guard soldier and left another critically injured in Washington.

title: Madras High Court modifies stalker’s death sentence to life imprisonment
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and M. Jothiraman order that he would not be entitled for any remission until he completes 20 years of incarceration

title: Telangana GP Elections-2025 | 3,242 nominations received for 4,236 Sarpanch posts on first day
content: The last date to file the nominations for this phase is (5 p.m.) November 29, 2025. The list of contesting candidates would be published on December 3, 2025

title: Why are Srinagar’s traditional livelihoods struggling to survive? | Explained
content: How are wetlands, lakes, and mountains shaping Srinagar’s economy? What role did Article 370’s dilution play in local livelihoods? Why are tourism, horticulture, and artisan trades struggling? What strategies can build a resilient, locally rooted economy?

title: Vice President approves Panjab University senate poll schedule, students say will end stir on Nov 28
content: Panjab University students, who have been protesting and pressing for the election schedule, hailed it as a "victory" of their "struggle".

title: Brainybotz robotics club boosts STEM learning for kids in Visakhapatnam
content: Brainybotz is shaping a culture of hands-on STEM learning for children in Visakhapatnam. It will host the city’s first STEM expo on December 6 at GITAM

title: Woman constable injured in IED explosion in Sukma
content: The incident occurred during an area domination operation, when Constable Muchaki Durga of the District Force accidentally triggered a pressure IED, injuring her left foot

title: Pushing the panic button in West Bengal
content: With the start of SIR in West Bengal, all the major political parties in the State have taken a stand on the revision of electoral rolls. Except the BJP, all parties, including the ruling Trinamool Congress, are opposing the exercise, though they are participating in the process. Among the electorate, confusion and apprehension prevail, The Hindu reports

title: Man held for cutting elderly woman’s ear to steal gold earrings
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the victim, M. Salammal, was living alone in her house, with her children residing a few streets away in the same village.

title: Army chief charts three-phase plan to build future-ready force by 2047
content: Operation Sindoor demonstrates how structural readiness and modernisation can translate into decisive battlefield outcomes, says General Dwivedi

title: Union Law Ministry defends simultaneous polls proposal; says curtailing tenure not against basic structure of Constitution
content: Synchronisation of elections through amendment is permissible, Ministry tells the Parliamentary panel that is examining Bills

title: Telangana High Court directs Sigachi blast case investigating officer to appear before it
content: A Bench of Chief Justice Aparesh Kumar Singh and Justice G.M. Mohiuddin, hearing a PIL plea on Sigachi factory explosion that killed 46 persons, expressed concern over the delay in the probe to fix up responsibility for the explosion inside the factory

title: Two Trinamool workers killed in Bengal’s Malda; police deployed as tensions rise
content: Three people killed in Kaliachak within 48 hours as multiple rounds of shots fired; a local food vendor killed along with two TMC workers

title: Supreme Court asks government to consider a law against ridicule of PwDs
content: “Why don’t you bring some stringent legislation against insulting specially-abled persons, on the lines of the SC/ST Atrocities Act,” Chief Justice Surya Kant asked Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, for the Centre

title: Communal tag on 1983 Assam violence unwarranted: Resurrected panel’s report
content: The Tewary Commission of Enquiry said the fear of the Assamese of being outnumbered by outsiders was envisaged by British administrators much before the organisations spearheading the Assam Agitation were formed

title: Legal notice to Mumbai Police for failure to file FIR against BJP city president for hate speech
content: Days ago, Mumbai BJP Chief, Mr. Satam, stirred controversy after he said that Mumbai will not tolerate the “imposition of a Khan”

title: Orissa HC quashes govt order allowing MPs, MLAs to recommend teachers’ transfer
content: Teachers have to maintain safe distance from political parties and elected representatives, HC observes

title: Rajasthan taking steps to bring excess Yamuna waters during monsoon
content: The decision to divert excess Yamuna waters to Rajasthan follows an agreement signed with the Haryana government in February 2024 for getting the State’s full share of 1.119 billion cusec metre water as per the 1994 Yamuna Water Agreement

title: Telangana food safety officials flag compliance issues by e-commerce players
content: According to data, officials inspected 75 warehouses across 33 districts, seized 1,903 units of expired or misbranded food products and items with misleading labels

title: Sukanta Majumdar faces protests at Diamond Harbour, blames it on Trinamool Congress
content: The Trinamool Congress claimed that supporters of BJP leader Dilip Ghosh were protesting against Sukanta Majumdar

title: Bihar Congress leaders point out flaws after poll loss, but party high command sticks to vote chori
content: The leaders find fault with ticket distribution, “outsiders” being given tickets, lack of coordination with the RJD and leadership of the State’s AICC in-charge

title: After death of two basketball players, Haryana CM orders review of sports complexes
content: Haryana CM Nayab Saini expressed condolences over the deaths and announced ₹5 lakh as financial assistance to the families of each of the deceased

title: ‘Where is home? What is my identity?’ asks transgender community in West Bengal amid fear over SIR
content: With many estranged from families, lacking documents and facial mismatch after transition, trans persons fear exclusion and renewed trauma during electoral roll revision

title: RGCB to be national metagenomics project hub
content: Programme aims to address the challenge of undiagnosed acute febrile illness, encephalitis, diarrhoeal diseases, and respiratory infections

title: A.P. govt. plans 29 new substations to meet imminent spurt in power demand
content: Energy Minister asks AP-Transco and DISCOMs to submit progress reports on transmission and distribution projects every 15 days

title: A.P. CM calls for adoption of TTD’s best practices in major temples in State
content: TTD’s web portal should be linked with the RTGS for monitoring, says Naidu; officials share plans to automate kitchen to serve anna prasadam to 2.75 lakh people per day

title: APCRDA project office bags IGBC Net Zero Energy rating
content: The Project Office at Rayapudi has become the first government building in India to receive the IGBC Net Zero Energy Rating at the design stage

title: Ratan Tata Hub launches ‘SPARK’ to nurture early-stage innovators in A.P.
content: The initiative aims to strengthen Andhra Pradesh’s growing innovation ecosystem by providing structured guidance at the formative stages of entrepreneurship

title: Hyderabad Police unveils revamped surveillance grid, EYES teams to boost CCTV reliability
content: Commissioner V.C. Sajjanar describes it as a major overhaul of how the city maintains and upgrades its surveillance infrastructure

title: CM vows to address issues of Amaravati farmers
content: Naidu assures that he will seek an exemption for farmers from the payment of capital gains tax for more time

title: Review tender issuing methodology to prevent loss to State exchequer: Kerala HC to Chief Secretary
content: PIL claims that tenders awarded by the Irrigation department for desilting reservoirs of the State were causing substantial loss to the public exchequer

title: Appear before court or face non-bailable warrant: Telangana HC to HYDRAA Commissioner
content: It was hearing a contempt of court case filed by a businessman accusing the HYDRAA Commissioner of willfully disobeying the HC order over his claims on Bathukamma Kunta lake land

title: NBA Power Rankings: Raptors, Pistons battle for top of East standings
content: we're about one month into the 2025-26 NBA regular season and coming to the end of group play for the third-annual NBA Cup this week . the Detroit Pistons continue to be dominant through the first couple of weeks of play, climbing to the top of the Eastern Conference and 2.5 games ahead of the Toronto Raptors . our insiders break down this week's NBA power rankings .

title: 🏈 CFB Bottom 10: The 'Lane Train' hits the buffers

title: OKC's Williams off injury report; to debut Friday
content: Williams is off the injury report and will make his season debut against the Phoenix Suns on friday (1:03) the Thunder are off to a dominant start to this season at 18-1, with the best point differential through 19 games in NBA history at plus-16.5 .

title: Texas def. South Carolina on Harmon's late shot
content: Jordan Lee scores 19 points and Rori Harmon makes a 10-foot floater with a second left . the longhorns beat no. 2 south Carolina 66-64 in the women's title game of the Players Era Championship .
